team_info.description: A collaborative research project investigating corpus-informed and document-level machine translation improvements.

member_001.name: Alaina Brandt
member_001.description: I’m currently researching how machine learning can be aplied to my areas of specialization: translation and localization. I have professional development certificates in GAI and ML and data science from MIT, with a web programming certificate on the way.

member_002.name: Amber Wang
member_002.description: With a master’s degree in Localization Management, I work at the intersection of localization and globalization. I’m passionate about language technology and prompt engineering, and I like to think of myself as a “language solution architect.” Currently based in California.

member_003.name: Evelyn Johnson
member_003.description: CS Senior at the University of Illinois Chicago (UIC) with an Art minor, pursuing a Masters in CS next. Passionate about software/graphic design and game creation focused on accessibility. Portfolio showcases award-winning artwork and games!

member_004.name: Carolina Carreola
member_004.description: BA in Translation student at UNAM with a strong interest in corpus linguistics, language technology, and cross-cultural communication. Currently contributing to the Pragmatic Auto-Translator project with a focus on Spanish-Mexico data curation.

member_005.name: Abdurrahman Alyajouri
member_005.description: I’m pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science at Portland State University in Oregon. I have a strong interest in computer graphics, game and software development, and all things STEM. I love learning new concepts and applying them to build systems that solve real-world problems.

member_006.name: Alli Batell
member_006.description: I’m Alli, I’m majoring in CS, Digital Narrative and Interactive Design, and Studio Art at the University of Pittsburgh. I take a human-centered approach to software development and UX design.

member_007.name: Lin Ouyang
member_007.description: As a graduate student at Beihang University, my research interest lies in corpus linguistics, with a specific focus on Chinese-English contrastive analysis, aiming to enhance our understanding of language structure and use through quantitative analysis of naturally occurring language.

member_008.name: Catherine Wang
member_008.description: Hi! I’m a Math & Computer Science major at University of California - San Diego. I love learning new things. For example, I’m currently studying Spanish. I also enjoy solving puzzles.

member_009.name: Your Name Here
member_009.description: If you are interested in contributing your skills in corpus linguistics, automatic translation, or software development to the Pragmatic Auto-Translator project, we’d love to hear from you! Connect with Alaina if you are interested in joining the team.
